header: Red Line Update: Regular service has resumed between Harvard and Park St after earlier Cambridge Fire Department activity at Kendall/MIT. Continue to expect delays of about 20 minutes while our crews get service back on schedule.
short_header: Red Ln Update: Regular service has resumed between Harvard & Park St after earlier Cambridge fire at Kendall/MIT. Continue to expect delays

header: The Quincy Adams parking garage has re-opened with 500 spaces available. Additional spaces will be added as construction finishes up. Customers can access the garage via the Route 3 off ramp exit. The Burgin Parkway entrance remains closed.
short_header: The Quincy Adams parking garage has re-opened with 500 spaces available. Additional spaces will be added as construction finishes up. Custom
description:
Beginning November 29, the parking lot across from the station will close. Please use the garage or adjacent surface lot as an alternative.

The Quincy Adams Garage drop-off and pick-up location will remain at its location within Level 1B. 

The garage will be PayByPhone / PayByPlate with no need to pay to exit. More information on how to pay for parking is available at mbta.com/parking. 

Affected routes:
Red Line

header: Effective on Monday, February 13th, and through the end of 2023, the entrances to Natick Center station will be relocated to Washington Street for access to the inbound and outbound platforms.
short_header: As of on Mon, Feb 13th, & through the end of 2023, the entrances to Natick Center station will be relocated to Washington St.
description:
North Avenue entrance and Walnut Street entrance will remain closed until further notice. 

This access change will allow for work on the new platforms as part of Natick Center Station Accessibility Improvements Project.

header: Saturday, April 22nd, through Sunday, May 7th, buses replace trains between Haverhill & Reading to continue signal improvement work as part of the Commuter Rail Safety & Resiliency Program. Train service operates between Reading & North Station.
short_header: Sat, Apr 22nd, through Sun, May 7th, buses replace trains between Haverhill & Reading to continue signal improvement work.
description:
Normal train service will resume on Monday, May 8th.

-A dedicated schedule is in effect during the disruption. 
-Buses will be accessible, but bikes will not be allowed onboard.
-Buses will be free but passengers are expected to purchase regular fares for travel between Reading and North Station.

Bus pick up and drop off locations:
-Haverhill: on the parking lot, right next to the station shelter 
-Bradford: on the parking lot, next to the platform ramp
-Lawrence: at 220 Merrimack Street for inbound service. At 211 Merrimack Street for outbound service.
-Andover: at the bus/train shelter on the station side for outbound service, on the other side of Railroad Street for inbound service
-Ballardvale: on the station side of Andover Street for outbound service, on the opposite side of inbound service (next to Spinner Pizza Parlor)
-North Wilmington: On Middlesex Avenue, on the station side just before the sidewalk for inbound service and on the other side of the street, next to the hair salon for outbound service
-Reading: At the MBTA Bus #137 stop on Lincoln street (station side)

header: Saturday, April 22nd through Monday, May 15th, buses will replace weekend and weekday train service between Rockport and West Gloucester to allow for maintenance work on the tracks and the Gloucester drawbridge.
short_header: Sat, Apr 22nd through Mon, May 15th, buses will replace weekend & weekday train service between Rockport & West Gloucester to allow for main
description:
Normal train service will operate between West Gloucester and North Station. 

Regular train service will resume on Tuesday, May 16th.

Bus pick up/drop off locations:
-At Rockport: In the parking lot next to the high-level platform ramp.
-At Gloucester: On Railroad Ave, at the bus cut near the high-level platform.
-At West Gloucester: In the station parking lot across from the platform shelter.

header: Commuter Rail service at South Attleboro is temporarily suspended due to significant deterioration of the pedestrian overpass. Service will resume & the pedestrian overpass will reopen when the station Accessibility Improvement Project is fully completed.
short_header: Commuter Rail service at S Attleboro is temporarily suspended due to significant deterioration of the pedestrian overpass.
description: Local GATRA and RIPTA bus service at the station will not be impacted. Riders may also consider Attleboro Station as a temporary alternative.

header: Effective October 1st, Lynn Station is closed in order to be rebuilt as part of the Lynn Commuter Rail Station Improvements Project. A free shuttle bus service is provided between Lynn and Swampscott until a temporary platform is built.
short_header: As of Oct 1st, Lynn Sta is closed in order to be rebuilt as part of the Lynn Commuter Rail Sta Improvements Project. A free shuttle bus serv
description:
During the station closure, riders may use Bus Routes 441/442 and 455 from Lynn to connect to Wonderland station for continued Blue Line subway service into Boston.

Although Swampscott is a Zone 3 station, Lynn riders who board at Swampscott may purchase Zone 2 tickets and passes.

For more info: MBTA.com/projects/lynn-commuter-rail-station-improvements 



Affected stops:
Lynn
